value.title: The Aftermath Of COVID-19: Future Of Logistics Reimagined With AI
value.excerpt: With the waves of disruption slowly settling, logistics firms are now actively on the hunt for creative ways to optimize their operations

value.title: Europe’s funding for deep tech like AI and VR fell 13% in 2020
value.excerpt: As European startups have tried to carve out a competitive edge against the U.S. and China, there has been a big push to promote so-called “deep tech.” And in recent years, there had indeed been a surge in European startups that were developing products based on scientific breakthroughs.

value.title: How AWS aims to democratize machine learning with cloud services
value.excerpt: Swami Sivasubramanian, vice president of Amazon AI, will hold the first-ever re:Invent keynote on the topic, a clear sign that AWS views AI and machine learning as an area ripe for reinvention. AWS Chief Executive Andy Jassy (pictured) told me that the company’s overall aim is to enable machine learning to be embedded into most applications before the decade is out by making it accessible to more than just experts.

value.title: $50K AI Prediction Contest Launches Today

value.title: Uber exits self-driving car sector, sells business to Aurora
value.excerpt: Uber will invest in Aurora to help bring the technology to life and benefit from Aurora's expected progress in the future.

value.title: Brainchip leads the ASX’s top small cap AI stocks in 2020

value.title: AWS Expands Think Big, ATO, AI/ML Rapid Adoption Programs

value.title: Machine learning identifies new brain network signature of major depression
value.excerpt: Using machine learning, researchers have identified novel, distinct patterns of coordinated activity between different parts of the brain in people with major depressive disorder—even when different protocols are used to detect these brain networks.

value.title: Researchers are starting to refuse to review Google AI papers
value.excerpt: Computer scientists are beginning to refuse to review Google AI papers until Google changes its stance on former ethics co-lead Timnit Gebru.

value.title: Apple’s 2021 chip strategy will create a massively parallel universe
value.excerpt: Apple's Macs will soon march into data centers, equipped with multi-core CPU, GPU, and AI capabilities in tiny, power-efficient form factors.

value.title: Researchers can use qsim to explore quantum algorithms
value.excerpt: A year ago, Google’s Quantum AI team achieved a beyond-classical computation by using a quantum computer to outperform the world’s fastest classical computer. value.title: The IPO market looks hot as Airbnb and C3.ai raise price targets

value.title: IBM OpenPages with Watson can deliver a 218% return on investment, finds Forrester study

value.title: How DeepMind boss Demis Hassabis used chess to get billionaire Peter Thiel to ‘take notice’ of his AI lab
value.excerpt: Demis Hassabis, the co-founder of AI lab DeepMind, has revealed that he talked about chess instead of his start-up idea when he first met Peter Thiel.

value.title: The Lumbee have waited a long time for federal recognition. This month will be critical.
value.excerpt: The Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina has been seeking federal recognition for more than 100 years. Could Congress include recognition among must-pass legislation this month?

value.title: Meet Ghost Robotics, the Boston Dynamics of combat bots
value.excerpt: Ghost’s quadruped bots are the scary older brother of every other dog robot you’ve ever seen. And with good reason. They’re shipping off to join the military.

value.title: AWS Cloud Tech to Power MGM Media Supply Chain
value.excerpt: SEATTLE—Amazon Web Services has reached a multi-year deal with Metro Goldwyn Mayer (MGM) that will power MGM’s media supply chain with AWS cloud technology to help distribute its TV and film content across multiple platforms.

value.title: Juniper Networks acquires datacenter network automation startup Apstra
value.excerpt: Juniper Networks acquired Apstra, a startup specializing in datacenter network automation, for an undisclosed sum.

value.title: Deepcell raises $20 million to identify cells with computer vision
value.excerpt: Deepcell, a startup developing technologies to identify cells using computer vision, has raised $20 million in venture capital.

value.title: How banks use AI to catch criminals and detect bias

value.title: 3 Top Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy in December
value.excerpt: These days, artificial intelligence is showing up in all sorts of new services. There's a reason: The use of AI is growing fast, and businesses putting it to good use are unlocking efficiencies and delivering better experiences to their customers.

value.title: Artificial network model describes entire movement planning in the brain
value.excerpt: Every day we effortlessly make countless grasping movements. We take a key in our hand, open the front door by operating the door handle, then pull it closed from the outside and lock it with the key.
